chapter.title: Introduction
chapter.subtitle: What is &C2; and what it is not
chapter.para: &C2; is a library and a set of supporting applications you can use to build a search results clustering engine. Such an engine will organize your search results into topics, fully automatically and without external kowledge such as taxonomies or preclassified content.

&C2; contains component for fetching search results from several search engines, such as Yahoo!, MSN Live, Google, but it also supports other sources of documents like Lucene, Solr or Google Desktop index. &C2; contains two document clustering algorighms designed specifically for search results clustering: Suffix Tree Clustering and Lingo.

section.title: &C2; application suite
section.para: &C2; comes with a number of supporting applications that you can use to tune clustering results and expose &C2; clustering through different protocols.

formalpara.title: &DCW;
formalpara.para: You can use &DCW; to experiment with &C2; clustering using data from common search engines or your own data. &DCW; allows you to tune the clustering algorithm attributes and see how the results change in real time.

formalpara.title: &DCS;
formalpara.para: &DCS; exposes &C2; clustering as a REST service.
